document_data.caption: Map showing the west end of Julthoon Street.
document_data.name: Julthoon Street
document_data.mainbody: '''Julthoon Street''' was a major eastâ€“west thoroughfare in [[Waterdeep]]. It was the dividing line between the [[Sea Ward of Waterdeep|Sea Ward]] to the north and the [[Castle Ward of Waterdeep|Castle Ward]] to the south as of the [[1276 DR|Year of the Crumbling Keep, 1276 DR]].
document_data.Geography: Julthoon stretched from the cliffs of [[Gull Leap]] on the coast of the [[Sea of Swords]] to the [[High Road (Waterdeep)|High Road]] in the [[North Ward of Waterdeep|North Ward]]. At Gull Leap, Julthoon connected with [[Westwall Street]] and the [[Cliffride]]. Along the way to North Ward it touched or connected with many other streets and alleys including [[Jelzar's Stride]], [[Seaeye's March]], [[Toalar's Lane]], [[Darselune Street]], [[Gothal Street]], [[Melshar's Street]], [[Haltovar Street]], [[Tchozal's Race]], and [[Copper Street]].
document_data.Notable Locations:
Some points of interest along Julthoon Street included:
; The [[Field of Triumph]]
: A huge stadium used for both official and entertainment purposes.
; The [[Spires of the Morning]]
: A beautiful temple dedicated to [[Lathander]].
document_data.History: In the [[1255 DR|Year of the Raging Flame, 1255 DR]], the walls protecting Waterdeep were expanded to keep up with the growth of the city. A portion of the new wall was built along the path of what would become Julthoon street when the walls were moved again in 1276 DR. At the western end of the street, a 90 ft (27 m) [[Sahuagin Humbled|Walking Statue]] stood on Gull Leap until around the [[1370 DR|Year of the Tankard, 1370 DR]].
